overview:
As the CEO of Audiosocket, Brent works with his business partner Jenn Miller, investors, employees and customers crafting a vision and strategy that benefits not only the company but also the musicians and media producers it has set out to assist.

In the last two years of operations Brent has helped establish relationships with MTV, ABC, NBC, 2K Games, Disney and a number of other international media companies. He has successfully raised over 1.2 Million dollars in capital and grown the company’s expansion from Seattle to offices in New Orleans, Los Angeles and New York.

He first made his mark as Co-founder of Interface Booking and Management. Interface was a Seattle based booking and management agency in charge of the talent buying for three Seattle successful music venues: High Dive, Nectar Lounge and Tost. The company managed such artists as KJ Sawka, Emilia Sosa, DJ Motion Potion and Chrisopher Blue. Having booked their artists on national tours, they leveraged those successes and secured appearances at acclaimed music festivals like Bonnaroo, Vegoose, New Orleans Jazz and Heritage Festival and Bumbershoot. Ten plus years in the music business gives Brent a unique perspective on the industry and the changes itâ€™s facing. Being born and raised in New Orleans, he was recently featured on the cover of Entrepreneur Magazine in a story on entrepreneurs bringing business back to New Orleans after Katrina.

You can watch his interview on Bloomberg Television’s show â€˜Ventureâ€™ here: http://audiosocketmusic.com/venture
